instructions.label: drill_how_to_practice_1
instructions.translation:
You should only wash your hands with warm water.

a) true
b) false

instructions.label: drill_how_to_fact_5
instructions.translation: HECHO: Los g√©rmenes pueden transferirse m√°s f√°cilmente entre manos mojadas.

instructions.label: drill_how_to_fact_2
instructions.translation: FACT: Hot water is great for getting oil off of your hands! When it comes to germs - hot and cold water are equally effective. Good handwashing is about the amount of soap you use and how long you scrub your hands.

instructions.label: drill_how_to_fact_4
instructions.translation: HECHO: Las bacterias son m√°s probables de esconderse debajo de las u√±as.

instructions.label: drill_how_to_fact_4
instructions.translation: FACT: Bacteria are most likely to be hiding underneath your nails.

instructions.label: drill_how_to_practice_2
instructions.translation:
How much soap should you use when you wash your hands?

a) 1 pump
b) 2-3 pumps
c) none

instructions.label: drill_how_to_fact_5
instructions.translation: FACT: Germs can be transferred more easily to and from wet hands.

instructions.label: drill_how_to_fact_3
instructions.translation: FACT: Pump enough soap to cover your hands. That means 2+ pumps!
